benchmark_details.name: SC-TC-Bench (Simplified Chinese - Traditional Chinese Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: We provide an open-sourced benchmark dataset to foster reproducible evaluations of future LLM behavior across Chinese language variants.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate potential LLM performance disparities when prompted in Simplified versus Traditional Chinese and to audit the performance and biases of LLMs in these language variants.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark covers several important real-world contexts but does not comprehensively cover all differences in Simplified and Traditional Chinese.

data.source: Dataset includes question-answer pairs reflecting regional term choice and regional name choice tasks, collected with the help of native speakers and manual reviews.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the percentage of correct responses in relation to regional term identification and name selection tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in recognizing regional terms and names specific to Simplified and Traditional Chinese prompts.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative performance of 11 leading commercial and open-source LLMs in regional term choice and name selection tasks.
methodology.validation: Results were verified through multiple prompting trials and statistical analyses.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark considers the implications of different regional biases, reflecting the cultural significance of language usage in Mainland China and Taiwan.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential representational harms in LLMs' outputs when prompted in varying Chinese language scripts.
